commit message: Allow the user to just convert the incompatible algos to the closest match, with a warning that states this may produce different results.  Also now list the algos that were ignored, if the checkbox was not checked.
Allow using custom character sets.

Only show verification code if number of characters is greater than 8.  This is an intermediate fix until I figure out how to do a timer correctly.  I like the idea that the chrome version does a 600 MS delay as well.
Add toast to declared that the password is copied to the clipboard.

Save inputs for some length of time, after user requested to save the inputs.  This though stores the user password in plain text, but nothing really that I can do about it, unless android gave me some shared secret that I could use at runtime, otherwise I would either have to hardcode the key used to encrypt, or write a key to disk, which if the user can get the encrypted password on disk, they can get the key on disk too.
Allow creation of new folders for the account tree.  Also updated the import/export icon to something thats closer to the correct symbol.
Slightly better actionbar icons.
Adding a real app icon
Issue #5 - Fixed the way we do the Algo selection so that I can support the older MD5 version where it didn't trim the leading characters.
Making the default values for a new account be that of the default account.  Seems reasonable.
Update the message for the conversion warning in the import feature.
Adding the ability to store the master password hash.
Added a button to generate a regex template to help with pattern creation.
Adding this as a resource string.
the classic settings importer.  Though really the profiles doesn't make sense in the account layout, as profiles never had a set url, and only 1 profile can have a url parts and match on them.
Because this doesn't make sense, lets just delete the code.  I committed this so that it will be in git.
Allow ability to manually select an account by long clicking on an account.
Fixing lint warnings
Allow release signing/packaging to work in gradle
Filled in some more of the README.md file on how to build, package, and use.  Still assume some android experience.
Fixed headers
adding general user section
One day I will remember which one needs () and which needs []
Bumping version to next version
